document_data.name: Rockburst
document_data.mainbody: '''''Rockburst''''' was an [[evocation]] spell that cause a boulder or pile or rubble to explode.
document_data.Effects:
This spell caused an amount of stone to explode, possibly damaging any creatures within {{SI|20|ft|long=yes}} of the center of the blast. Stone-made possessions of others and magic objects made of stone had a chance to resist the spell. Additionally, creatures that were made of stone were typically immune to ''rockburst''.

For the early version of this spell, the amount of stone was at least {{SI|3|cu ft|long=yes}}, and more for casters with greater experience. For the later version of this spell, the amount was a minimum of {{SI|8|cu ft|long=yes}}.
document_data.Components: This spell only required [[verbal]] and [[somatic component]]s to cast.
document_data.Usage: [[Dwarven]] [[priest]]s of [[Clanggedin Silverbeard]] were typically known to have this spell bestowed upon them.
